marklogic.body: A little history here: atmospheric Heat trapping became scientifically and politically sexy when, back in the 1970s, NASA probed Venus. It was a lot hotter than expected and the atmosphere was a likely suspect. "Greenhouse effect" as pertains to the Earth is a misnomer... since greenhouses rely on the convection barrier of their transparent roofs... and there is no such thing for our atmosphere... other than the pull of gravity. Heat trapping estimates for CO2 are theoretical... especially on a planetary scale. CO2 is also "igneous"... existing in a natural state within the bowels of the Earth... and occasionally venting into the atmosphere in immense quantities. Final note: all bio-matter or biomass... fossilized or otherwise... is carbon based. All of that carbon was taken from CO2 in the atmosphere... even though at current readings it is only 0.4% of the of the entire gas cocktail.
